review: It's a Friday's. We ordered the 3 for $12.99 and 2 for $10. I got the fried mozzarella, Parmesan crusted chicken, and the peanut butter cup cheesecake. Joy got the Jack Daniels pulled pork sandwich and the spinach artichoke flatbread.  The food was ok ... It's Friday's.

I came here on a Wednesday at 5.  I had no idea the place would be so packed that I would be ignored for 25 minutes before I lost interest in even eating here. To be fair, this location is quite nice - much nicer than any other Friday's I've ever been to.  There's about 50 or so seats up at the bar and plenty of tables.  It wasn't people in their work clothes who were visiting here; it was people who were only here to watch a soccer game. The length of time it took to serve me left a very bitter taste in my mouth, and I probably won't be coming back.

I generally like T.G.I. Friday's however this particular location feels that since they get enough traffic from being next to the Movie Theater in Tyson's Corner Mall they can provide smaller portions sizes than other locations and provide worse service.  If you want to go here for a "quick" bite before your movie - chances are you won't make your movie. Can someone show me how to rate 0 stars?

My wife and I were headed to the movies and decided to grab a bite before hand. We sat at the bar on a Sunday night (tonight) and the place was packed. The energy in TGI is upbeat and there are a lot of TV's going on at once.  The bar maid told us about the food and my wife ordered a French Onion soup which was really delicious. Very well done and cheesy. I ordered the tomato soup, which was also very tasty, hot and filling. We ordered the mediterranean with steak and they took a while (too long) to bring us the appetizer size, we ordered the meal. So they re-ordered it and that took a while too, maybe 20 minutes.  When we got the first wrong dish we had a few bites before we realized it was not what we wanted. After we told the bar maid we asked another if we should eat this or if she was going to take it away. Seamed a waste to dump it, but she did, just chucked it in the trash or we could pay for both.  Another bar maid said that the manger insisted on taking both food items off of our check, very nice of them. We enjoyed the med (beef) in the theater very much. We would go back again and perhaps sit at a table. The food was really good and they fixed their mistake in the end.

Probably will never eat at this place unless during happy hours.  $4 margarita and 50% off of almost all the appetizers are pretty good deal. But of course, a great place to hang out with friends, just to drink and eat appetizers. It's decent. :)

i've been to this tgi friday plenty of times, each time i've gone during mid day the food is prepared tasteful and yummy like the jack daniel burger order, although i wasnt a fan of the sweet potato fries. however, past 10pm, the food tastes dried and as if it has been prepared hours ago and the waiters act like they dont want to be there and are soo slow.    great place, just not at night time unless your planning on getting drinks

Great place to grab a pre-movie drink. I usually hang at the bar & get a nice drink before walking over to amc next door. The bartenders are super nice & one of our bartenders conjured up a nice shot called "the bong." I recommend asking for it, it was a nice sweet taste with different liquors in it. It did the trick that's for sure! Plus, the bartender was always attentive. The weekends are busy but the service keeps up with it very well.

4 Stars for the Sports BAR scene!  On June 2, 2012, TGIF bar patrons and I witnessed the OKC THUNDER beating the San Antonio Spurs in game 4 of the NBA Western Conference finals!  The bar crowd was pro-Thunder as blue and white and gold yellow gear was all over!  OKC chants were heard as KD (Kevin Durant) scored 16 straight points in the 4th quarter. There were plenty of TVs and game sound in the bar; however, one of the bigger TVs needs to be replaced ASAP!  Thunder blue was displayed as a Teal color!  Fortunately I focused my attention on another TV with the correct color.  Thunder up!

It could get busy on the weekends so if you like the crowded and noisy atmosphere then go for it. The food is okay and it's good that they always have promotions. Go there for someone's birthday and they'll sing to your table while bringing out a complimentary ice cream dessert =) Never had a bad experience.

Everyone knows the trouble a large group can run into when trying to eat dinner together at a restaurant. We didn't have a reservation, yet we came with 10 guests and wanted separate checks. This particular FRIDAYS did an AMAZING job accommodating us last night. The host was great as well as the manager. We originally were seated in the restaurant area, when we realized that we couldn't get the happy hour deals unless we sat  in the bar. We were then moved to a smaller table in the bar that didn't fit all of our group. We then found two small tables that the hosts combined together to fit us all. Our server, Patrick, was amazing and very attentive and personal. We had a wonderful time! Thanks FRIDAYS! Oh and I had the 2 for $10 deal- Bruschetta Chicken Pasta with shrimp and the salted caramel cake. Delicious!

This place is good just a tip for people that love chicken fingers, don't order them from here. This place is so busy they get there chicken fingers precooked so all they have to do is re heat them, but it makes them extra crispy and sometimes burnt. Not a fan of the process.

Every time I come here, it seems like it gets worse and worse.  True, it's a convenient place to eat before/after a movie, but I'd recommend you take your money elsewhere. The last time I was here.  I would have to emphasize the LAST time I was here, our server was outright rude, the food service was slow, and the food was incredibly bad - imagine a school cafeteria lunch bad for adults. I don't know how else to portray our server except maybe an ex-junkie, maybe even a current junkie.  At times, he would talk about how "busy" he was, and I couldn't see any other tables he was servicing.  He couldn't remember to bring us anything - to include drinks, straws, utensils.  He also gave us major attitude about splitting up the check, and yet while we were writing our tips, he was all "apologetic" about how many tables he had to serve and he made many excuses for his horrible behaviour.   All the food I had was too salty/msg-laden sweet.  I think I had the salmon teriyaki kabobs.  I'm trying not to remember it.  Even my lemonade tasted nasty.  Seriously, they couldn't even get the water/condensed syrup mixture right.  Never again.  I'd rather pay and eat movie theatre food.
How they manage to ruin a ceasar salad is beyond me.  Good bar though.
It's a good place for happy hour. However service is a hit or miss depending on the waiter and if its busy or not.
Nice drink selection in the reasonable price. Ok service don't like the beer dip with pretzel that much.
great vibes. good food. friendly servers. hosts are kinda rude sometimes. try the Pretzels With Craft Beer-Cheese Dipping Sauce!! it's amazing, i always get it!

Friday's is Fridays.  Not a knock, but  a good compliment.  I wasn't blown away by the service.  I for one am the type who likes to be bombarded by the server and not have to call them down.  This didn't diminish my experience, but you like to be treated like a welcomed guest at all times.  The food was good, A-OK

This place was great. I am from Florida and my wife and I went during Hurricane Sandy and while everyone else was closed my natural instict is to go out still. If you read my previous reviews on TGI Fridays you will see that I haven't had much luck with them but this place was amazing. Our waiter was right on the ball and was very nice. If this location wasnt too far away I would go more often.

I recent had the opportunity to dine here for dinner.  The place was pretty packed but there wasn't a wait for dinner.  The server provided good service and the meal was pretty good.  My "partner in crime" tried the Warm Pretzels with Craft Beer-Cheese Dipping Sauce and Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Pasta without complaints.  I enjoyed the Sizzling Chicken & Cheese.  For dessert we tried the Whiskey Cake, which a new item on the menu.  It was very, very good! Overall it was a good experience and I would consider returning.

Hmmmm...It was really hard for me to decide between 2 or 3 stars...came here with a large group of 20+ people. Totally understand that this is a chaotic number of people to accommodate and seat together.  When we arrived, they had 3 tables put together in the middle of the dining area towards the back and they kept adding, moving, shifting the tables and US as more of our party started arriving.  The manager, it seems like, tried explaining to us how we can't block the walkway due to fire hazard blah blah blah... So...everyone arrived, our waitress started off with a great job taking everyone's order...hence everyone had a separate tab! Then...kinda went downhill from there. Drinks took way too long..when she came around to order, she didn't bother asking one of our guest for her order(which she didn't mind bc she kind of stuffed herself with the appetizers that came out way to late too), food took way too long (my son at this point is telling me for the millionth time how hungry he is), food was not that great(everything tasted it was cooked with the same sauce..way too sweet), after dinner no one bothered to ask for us for dessert(took our plates away and started collecting our payments)...so at the end, kinda felt like we were being rushed out...urgh I hate that feeling at restaurants!  Will I go there again? Probably most likely not...

hi, me and my girlfriend, we went out yesterday to have some steak, despite having a really bad day, my gf and me as nice as we can, we got to our table and got serve with a "dude", we try to order and he didn't even try to write it down, he forget the drink we order and comeback and ask what we would like for drink. he brought 2 drink up without straw, so i try to call him, but he ignore me, i have to go and get the straw myself. then we pay for everything, and 18% tips for the dude, we rush to get some thing at HM for 10mins and went back, we got to our table, the food was cold and dry, the fall of the bone rips wasn't fall off the bone, and the medium rare was medium well. we ask our server again, and he didn't come, i personally step up to him and tell him to come to our table, instead he walk other direction. so we ask someone else. i was mad, but i talk nicely to the manager and so on, we waited for another 15 minutes, our serves bring out the food, which throw it on the table in front of me and my girl. my girl was mad as f*ck, but i try to calm her. i still see that greedy eyes of our server, but i have a bad day, and i just don't want to go another step futher, and my girl was there too. but the servicee was terrible, the food was cold, and because we gave him tips already, the entrie of our dinning there was no services, our drink was water and never got refill, there was no cherrry in my girl drink. we been there every weekend, sometime weekday, onetime the food was cold, and dry, but our sever was not as bad as this dude. and he exchange it without us spoken to the manager, because it's clearly cold. just so if you wonder where the store was it is a Tyson Corner, VA. my girl never want to be there again. so i guess that's it. just want to share with you guys our experience.

I think that TGIFriday can have very different experiences based on what you order. At this location we ordered a salmon dish and the nacho and queso dip. The dip came out in a cast iron skillet and was a very good dip and the chips were nice and fresh. The salmon was really tasty and the service was decent.

WHAT HAPPENED TO TGI FRIDAY'S??? My boyfriend and I had a craving for wings and ribs, and we thought what better place to go to than Friday's. I have been there before and it was ok, though Friday's in other countries is better. This time being in America we thought the service would be even better but were very shocked. Our waitress took our orders and brought the wings pretty fast but then disappeared. I had to call someone else to get two empty plates because we were sharing the platter, the guy brings them and they are disgustingly dirty, with old food stuck on them. I had to get up and look for someone to bring other plates, they were not even apologetic about it. Then came the main course after 30 minutes of waiting, the waitress had clearly forgotten about us, and it was wrong. When I brought it up she was rude and arrogant and looked like she was going to slap me. She then got the drinks wrong and took another 20 minutes. They didn't even bother to bring forks and knives for which I had to get up myself. It's such a horrible feeling when they just dump the food and things on the table with no care in the world. Last I heard this was a restaurant not a cafeteria in prison. The worst part was when we asked for the check, of course she took for ever but then brought back wrong change twice, trying to cheat us on $3 as if we were not going to notice or we couldn't count. Very bad waitress and trying to steal on top of it? We were very disappointed and will never go back. This was at Tyson's Corner mall in Virginia. Oh food is also only SO SO mass produced, the wings and ribs I make at home are soooo much better. :(

I came by with some co workers for after work drink(s). Sat at the bar and dealt with my very first bartender that just made me want to not drink and to just go home. He was beyond rude and did not want to tend to the bar at all! We did not get a hello, hey, hi, whats up, or anything! After waiting 15 minutes, the bartender gave us a menu and just stared at us. Rude Bartender: *stares* Me: Margarita please Rude Bartender: *bulges eyes* Me: on the rocks? salt? heres my id? Rude Bartender: *hands a watered down lime juice cocktail* My friend ordered one of their special margaritas- a tiny bit better than my margarita. My other friend asked him which margarita is the strongest and he replied, "JUST GIVE ME YOUR ID MAN!" Literally yelled this at us. At this moment, I just really wanted to get up and leave. MIND you that we all are in the service industry and as a server, I do expect you to be polite to say the least.  I WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE. Also, there are no late night drink specials like the other Friday's I have been to.

My boyfriend and I went to dinner there one night and we had an amazing waitress named Liz. She was helpful, kind and considerate and let us know about the 1/2 off items. If you are going to TGI Fridays and want to be seated in a good section, ask for Liz. She works pretty much the whole summer there and is always super efficient and provides speedy service with bringing out your food. You'll be in and out of there in no time! :-)

This location used to be great but the recent changes in management and staff has dragged this spot to the bottom for the food chain. No pun intended. The new furniture and swag is over run in red, I preferred the old sports looks, made it feel more classic. The staff is not too friendly and the food is over priced for the quality. I will not be returning anytime soon but hope others have a better experience than me.
This location need to clean walls there is to many spills and marks  all over the place .

Definitely a weak link in TGI's chain.  Admittedly,  they are probably usually busy given the mall/movie location but still they are sadly lacking in many ways: -Our wait staff, Carlos, was MIA for the first 10 mins.  -We noticed the drinks had no prices on the menu (?!) so we asked the Maitre D. who also did not know the prices or reason behind not disclosing them. Carlos, finally arrived on the scene but he also does not know the prices except for one, "the most expensive cocktail is $10", helpful? Not.  -The house salad is described as having red cabbage and arriving with a hot garlic breadstick. Neither made an appearance. We politely noted this to Carlos so he would not get dinged for the kitchen's mistakes but he seemed somewhat gormless at this stage. The half rack of ribs were delicious, fell off the bone and nice touch to have the sauce on the side to cater for different tastes. We did wait 45 mins for the food to arrive though, FYI. My 11-year old son asked for a refill of his Sprite but Carlos forgot.  We had given up by this time. The restaurant was very quiet by this stage, so it not like he was overly busy. We did leave %15 tip as I always feel for wait staff. However, see below Overall my experience:  the service was poor, food slow, response to issues raised lacked customer awareness, restaurant was too cold (I sat with my winter coat on. Guys it is November 20th already, can we get a little heating please?) and we ended up getting dessert somewhere else. I wish I could be more positive but this is my strong impression. Good luck. D

ordered two stack burgers, with mayo on the side.  the ordering waiter did not deliver the plates to our table, the delivery waitress, instead, announced the wrong burgers.  asked her to check with the ordering waiter who had ordered what.  he had to be roused from the next booth!  but we still got the wrong plates, the orders were switched, i.e. by placing the other's plate in front of the wrong person, and i didn't realize it until i tasted the bleu cheese, indicating i was given the wife's plate. the manager was called, and finally agreed that the philly stack burger had been switched with an american stack burger, and got it replaced with the correct order. so one burger had been switched, and also both plates had been delivered to the wrong person.  it is hard for the customer to detect this before actually biting into it, because different stack burgers can be very similar in appearance. finally  the food quality, in terms of hot freshness, of both sandwich and fries was way below par,  the service which was incompetent and/or inattentive, did not rate a tip either.

This is one of those places that without booze would be no fun at all.  Luckily, the bartenders are super friendly and keep the booze flowing.  The food is pretty much what you'd expect.  I consider TGIF to be at the top end of the casual dining chain restaurants (Chili's, Applebees, etc.) and this location is no exception.  Do the MAc & Cheese bites from the Taste & Share menu-you'll be soooo glad you did.   TGIF seems to have reinvented themselves pretty successfully as a pretty happening bar scene.  The bartenders throw bottles in the air and make some STRONG drinks.  Do the Blackberry Long Island and the Patron Cosmo Rita Shaker.  Both are awesome.   It is in the mall food court right near the movie theater so it stays BUSY.

This is the worst restaurant. I'm not exactly sure how they are still running. I went to grab dinner with a friend close to a month ago. It took the waitress 20 minutes to bring water. After we finally ordered, it was another 20 minutes until the food came out. The pretzel with cheese sauce was disgusting. The food was burned. Not sure how you can burn frozen pretzels. Seriously?! Then, we were ready for the check (this is 1.5 hours into our visit) and we ask her for the check. I don't know WHAT THE HECK this chick was doing. It was like she was attempting to multitask, but doing a horrible job doing so. She went back to the kitchen to get waters and food, went ALLL the way around the restaurant to come back to us 10 minutes later with the check. Then, she's closes 3 checks out and does it again! Even the table next to us went to find her to get their check. Service sucked, the waitress sucked. The food was terrible and way overpriced. By the way this was on a Tuesday. I can't imagine how they function on a weekend. Never ever ever again. And the best part is that I've left negative reviews everywhere and even tried to contact fridays 3 times, no response. Good job management. I'm sure you all will be like bennigan's and won't be open for much longer. Learn to get some helpful staff and not charge $15 for a mixed drink, and then maybe you'll get less trashy and older then 21-year-olds or younger than 50-year-olds in your establishment. Awful.

Waitress was very friendly. Decent food. They forgot to add bacon to one sandwich, but the waitress noticed it and offered to replaced it. Manager came to apologize and provided a voucher. They handled the situation very well.
Good place to join friends and have a pleasant time and happy hours from 4 to 9 pm it's ok food but the drinks there very good  the most I liked was checking and shrimp cajin pasta

When I left this place u Wad so surprised by the quality of fid and drinks in this place. But mainly the food they have stepped it up big time from the last time I eat there like 7 years ago but at another location. The fid was fresh good. Drinks were good not cheap on the alcohol.i week Def go back again.

Good food bad service, our waiter check on us 10 minutes after the hostess sat us down,  we ordered our drinks and food. A few minutes he came back with out drinks, almost 1/2 hour later someone else brought our food, I asked that server for napkins and silverware; nothing. Another 1/2 hour later our waiter asks if we nerd

2 Stars because my boyfriend had a good experience a few weeks back but together we had a pretty bad one.  Our theory is that all the 4-5 stars reviews on here is based on their busy days Friday, Saturday, possibly Sunday? And the people with bad experience are the ones coming in early weekdays. When my boyfriend went with his friends on a Friday his steak was great, service was good and overall was pleased when he got home. We went together with a friend a month later on a Monday and didn't feel the same way.  Our waitress was a little off, when she ID me she said Happy Birthday after seeing my birth date but my birthday was a couple months ago. I even double checked my ID because I thought maybe I somehow took someone else. Afterwards she disappeared and didn't show up until after we got a food, which took about 35 minutes to get there. When our food did get there the steak wan't medium rare but well done. It was also extremely thin, not at all like the one my boyfriend ordered a month back, and the sides were warm/ near cool. My friends dish and mine were similar, lukewarm and lacking of something. Our friend didn't have any utensil because the waitress only gave us 2. We did try to flag her down but she was no where to be found so we just stole one from an empty table near us. The table behind us seemed frustrated with our waitress too and left in a hurry. We left without dessert because we had a movie to catch and I didn't know when we would see our waitress again.  We're planing to try again on a Friday and test our theory.

Wishy-washy service.  The first mojito was all simple syrup and filler. The second and third were better when we asked for less simple. For the last two I ordered  strawberry mojitos and got strawberries on the side both times. Where did you learn to bartend?

Food: On point and just what one would expect from a sit-down. I've ordered wings, flat breads, and burgers here and they were all great. No complaints at all. Service: The ONLY reason I gave this place 3 stars. My friends and I come here to take advantage of the amazing happy hour deals. Of the five times I have been here, I have never gotten a drink in under five minutes, food has taken at least ten minutes, and waiters/waitresses have checked our table MAYBE every ten minutes. And after asking for our check, we have to wait another 30 minutes. If wait times can be reduced, I would definitely give five stars for the pricing and quality of food. Environment: If a sports bar had a baby with a large open sit-down restaurant, this place would be the result.
Greasy wings .... Difficult to get through. The two stars are for good cocktails and service

Went here 8/10/14 with two friends. Two of us got the sizzling chicken and shrimp while the other got Friday's Shrimp. The chicken was sub-par but the shrimp was SO  terrible and possibly so old that it caused my friend and i to get really bad stomach aches which eventually caused my friend to go see the doctor because his stomach was hurting so bad into the next day. Never coming back. One of the worst food experiences of my life.

I've been here a few times and my experiences are alright.  I enjoy coming to the bar for happy hour. However sitting down at one of the tables is another story. Last two times I've been here the host and server forget to bring us utensils, even after serving us the food!  The service is a bit slow and it would be nice to be served immediately.  I might come again happy hour experience but think twice about coming for just food.

Wow, this place is getting no love here. I used to be a regular happy hour goer but since my move I havn't set foot inside. I used to love coming here every single day during the week to just kick back and enjoy 1 or 2 happy hour deal drinks.. ok.. maybe like 5 or 6 =)  The bartenders were the best part. Everyone was so nice and friendly, they made my drinks with extra love. I don't know if they still do it but on Thursdays a DJ comes in and holds it down. Definitely a good spot if you're just trying to kill time or just getting off of work and want to enjoy a cool drink made with extra lovvvvee ;)
This place is way too loud and the drinks are mixed really weak. I really only ever would go there when my friends want to.

Three words: Too. Much. Salt. Ordered the grilled chicken skewers with broccoli and the only discernable taste was salt. The kids meals were drenched in too much salt too. Come on Fridays....cut down on the salt and people might actually enjoy the food.

They are very busy now so the service is note the same and the kitchen is making mistakes  I order a burger with lettuce and tomatoes they served me bacon that I never ordered  they made me a new burger it was ok .

Get Hannah or Fred as your bartender/server and you will have a completely different experience than your typical Fridays. These two are the best!  Have been here a couple hundred times - literally. Typical Friday's fare, but good place to grab a drink before a movie/after shopping. Great burgers, apps and cheap drink prices!

I hate to even write these kinds of reviews. Our waiter was so proficient and so nice......BUT....there was a little cockroach in my boyfriend's burger.  Glad he hesitated for the first bite... This is 0/2 for the restaurants in the Tyson's Corner Mall.

Come here for the game, stay for the ribs.  I came during the world cup. I think England lost that game, oh well. Nevertheless, I was pleasantly surprised by Fridays.  The ribs were skinny but cooked well. The accompanying spinach and rice were seasoned appropriately. What else could you ask for?

Do not recommend this restaurant, especially for a group larger than 3. Brought a work group to the restaurant; never again. First round of drinks took 30+ minutes, and there was no second round because they never asked. Went to the bar to ask there, but was turned away because we had a table yet not a table with service. Also, beware of the NOT SO endless appetizers. Got the first round and was never even asked if another round of "endless appetizers" was needed before the check was brought. Worst part is, the first round was cold. Horrible service, will never go back.

My wife, adult daughter and I visited TGIFriday's and had a wonderful meal. Our server, Marco, was particularly attentive and make sure our drinks were always full. I thought the ribs were meaty enough, and very flavorful. My wif'e's salad was meal-sized and she split it with me in return for a few of my ribs. The lettuce was cool and crisp, and Marco brought us two different salad dressings when he saw that we were sharing the salad. We finished the meal with a shared ice cream dessert (cookies and cream) which was a little small but just perfect to end the meal. The next time we're at Tyson's Mall we'll look forward to returning.

I'm a regular here at the bar. I mainly come here because if the happy hour prices and the convenience. All the bartenders are awesome and I enjoy coming here to watch the games with coworkers and friends.
Service was OK, food was mediocre. Typical T.G.I Friday's right here. Only thing that really is good about it is it's conveniently located in the mall.

I think Friday's has gone through a bit of a rebrand! It's admittedly been a while since I've been a patron, but I gotta say I'm pretty impressed with all the new bells and whistles I saw this recent time when dining. They've redone the interior so it's pretty chic and slick looking now, with lots of mirrors and art on the walls, and fancy new hardcover menus. Aside from a bit of a weird thing where they seemed to run out of pagers and had to take down my phone number while we were waiting for a table, everything else on my recent visit to Friday's went swimmingly. Our server was very attentive (actually, every employee was like, crazy friendly!), my French Dip sammy was delicious, and overall I really have no complaints! I know it's a chain and all that, but hey, credit where credit's due. They're clearly making some changes and I think they're working for 'em! I definitely recommend the French Dip sandwich, as well as the green bean fries as an appetizer. They're my faaaavorite. This location gets really crowded on big movie nights, and when there are popular sports games on, but if you're looking to do the whole dinner-and-a-movie thing at Tysons, you can't beat the location!
very bad service. I have to wait for a long time when I come. And after I have done, I continue to wait for checking. I give them one star for very bad service. Food is normal, not delicious.

I love their waiters/waitresses. They are friendly, efficient, and informative. Seating and bar area is very spacious for strollers and babies. Food comes out great and fast even though it's busy there usually. Little things: they have blueberry iced tea which is scarce at places. :)

This is by far the worst TGI Fridays I've ever been to. My glass is sangria was only filled halfway and was WAY overpriced. $10 for half a glass of peach juice posing as sangria is ridiculous.  My husband's steak and lobster were not only tiny,  but cold. My pot stickers were either overcooked or freezer burnt,  but pot stickers are NOT supposed to be crunchy.We will never be returning to this restaurant again.

Went here yesterday for lunch with my friend. My first time ever eating at a Friday's and the food was pretty decent for a restaurant located in a mall. I ordered the Fridays shrimp which was pretty good, but a little on the salty side. I decided to get a side of coleslaw because you only get fries, shrimp, and cocktail sauce, but clearly I made a mistake that had to be some of the worst coleslaw I've tasted, but that's IMO. All in all it was a decent first experience for me.

This TGIFridays is always packed especially during game time.  My fiance came here for dinner tonight.  The wait time for the table was only 20 minutes (surprisingly for a Saturday evening).  We ordered a full rack of Jack Daniels ribs and the 3 for $15 sharable appetizers.  We went with the parmesan meatballs which I highly recommend.  We also ordered the ahi tuna which should be skipped! There's so much sauce and guac on it that you can barely taste the tuna.  And we ordered the Thai tacos that were pretty good.   As for service... Our server was quite busy watching the game today that he wasn't around to give us refills.  He basically took our order... Brought us our food and brought us our check. Eh.

I haven't been to this Fridays in about over a year and will not return. First of all my girlfriend and I wern't greeted at the door, so we just walked to the bar area and sat down on the high table tops. After waiting about 5 min, a server comes and tells us in a rude manner that we can't sit here because there is a wait. So we get off and go to the bar and since there wern't 2 seats available, I have my gf sit and I stood. The bartender comes and tell him our drink specials and then I tell him that I will have the bbq chicken flatfread and potatoe skins for my gf. 10 min pass by and my parents arrive and order food and drinks. 10 more min pass and the potatoe skins arrive, along with my parents food. The bartender  never put my order in when that was the first order I gave him. I didnt want to make a big deal because our movie was starting in 10 min. Nobody, not even the manager seemed to be sorry about what happened. Worst service I've ever seen at a Fridays!

This place is kind of a mixed bag. I came and was immediately seated which was nice. The not so nice part was that I waited twenty minutes. Not a single waiter or server came. The place wasn't unusually busy. There were a fair amount of people for a 4:00pm on a Monday.  After 20 minutes one of the guys came and asked me for my drink and apologized since he saw I was visibly irritated and he knew that no one had came. I waited another ten minutes then left.  I went to the bar instead and the bartender was really nice. She got my food order put in fast and was very polite. However I asked for a medium ribeye and got a well done one. I also asked for Mac and cheese and got mashed potatoes instead.  I guess the effort was nice but I don't think I'll be coming again.

Went for an early dinner. 1. The hostess at the front awkwardly decided to address the guest behind us before addressing us.  Thanks.. 2. We were given a buzzer, but it almost immediately went off.  I guess it's part of their protocol, but a bit unnecessary when there is clearly no line. 3. Service was very slow. 4. The other things are forgiveable because I don't care too much (it definitely doesn't help though), but to top it off, my burger, the very food (not the service) I came here to enjoy, came with a meager amount of innards (e.g. cheese, guac, jalapenos and whatever else was supposed to be in there).  When I go out to eat, I want to at least be able to enjoy my food and think I got what I paid for.. The fries were fairly tasty, but a bit undercooked. I guess they were nice by offering freebies, but that won't give me back my time or dignity. Good thing you can sit on the outskirts where you can stare at people walking by, or they can stare at you like an animal in a pen.

Have been here a few times and each time has been a delight. The service is great and the food has been correct each time, which in this day and age is a rarity.  One nice thing is it is right next door to the AMC theater at Tysons do a perfect place to get a pre/it's movie beverage or snack. Will come back for sure. Also a decent selection of beers and ciders on tap, have never been dissapointed.

Hit or miss depends on which server or bartender you get you may have a better or poor experience. The food is Fridays food so we don't have very high expectations for it what makes the difference is the service again that is a hit or miss. We frequent this place because we live close and its conveniently located by the movie theatre in the mall.

So we have tried going here twice before and every time was a miserable experience. (Below is a recounting of our second visit). However, we did decide to give it a try one last time to grab drinks and appetizers and boy was the third time a charm! Instead of sitting in the dining area like we had previously, we sat at a table in the bar area and were immediately greeted. Our server was Patrick and he was phenomenal.  He helped suggest drinks and what appetizers would match which drinks. He also made sure we had enough sauces and all of our special modifications were brought out perfectly. Even though the restaurant was very slow, instead of just standing around, Patrick was very engaging with us. And once we had a couple other tables, he still treated us exactly the same as he had when we were his only table. Absolutely some of the best service we have received in awhile. We definitely plan on being back (at least to the bar area). We wish there were more servers like Patrick everywhere! It's amazing how much of a difference an engaging server makes in a dining experience. "Our server did not speak English, I was brought a pasta with no sauce and the manager even stated that it came without sauce, although the menu explicitly described the sauce. Then the manager was very unprofessional and blamed it on other employees instead of simply resolving the issue. He also took my plate before giving me a chance to voice my issue.  Took 10 minutes for us to be greeted after we were seated, 20 minutes for our food (pasta and chicken tenders), and another 10 minutes for someone to return to our table while my naked pasta sat there. Another 20 minutes to recook a pasta.  Worst dining experience I've ever had. It was not all the server's fault; I place more of the blame on the Manager, KC Wang, for not being professional. It was very clear to us (fellow servers and managers) that this restaurant has terrible service and dining experience because it is led by an unprofessional manager.  Furthermore, this was not the first time we had tried eating here. The first time we sat for 15 minutes before being greeted by our server and when she finally arrived we got up and left because we waited so long and she rolled her eyes to us, saying "fine whatever snots".  If you want a dining experience anywhere near enjoyable, this would not be the place."
One of a very few places that stay open late in the areas. Better then chics n wings by far. In Tysons late night it's the place to go for a few drinks .

99% of my visits here are at the bar or the bar tables. So my review is strictly for the bar area.  I hate to admit that I do enjoy coming here from time to time for guilty bar appetizers (i.e. potato skins and wings) and great HH prices. Service has been fine too. No complaints here-- I rikes.

I don't always go to Tysons Corner, but when I do... well, I've been to this T.G.I. Friday's location twice, and both times everything was spot-on. No waiting, excellent service, and food that exactly hit the spot. Both times were for a somewhat late lunch - the first time I went with my wife, the second time we brought her parents. Both times I had the chicken fingers and my wife had a burger. Her parents split a rack of baby back ribs (I had a rib or two, and those were also great). As it happens, there is another T.G.I. Friday's a few blocks from where I live, which is awful compared to this one, and it surprising to find such a contrast between two franchises of the same business, but the one in Tysons Corner is clean, well kept, and obviously well run. If I had any complaint at all it would be the number of children running around and getting underfoot, but that's not really something an open-sided restaurant can control in a mall with its own choo-choo train.

This review is based strictly off the dessert and to watch the basketball game. Awesome place to watch sports. Plenty of TVs and bar space. I got the Tennessee whiskey Cake. Don't know where the whiskey came from but it just tasted like a gingerbread cake with nuts. It was okay. Didn't taste home baked but I know I  didn't come to a special bakery - it's TGI Fridays.  Bf on the other hand got a brownie overload. That was amazing. Warm, gooey,  fudgey and drizzled  in caramel and fudge with ice cream. we were both in sugar comas afterwards. Next time I will keep it light with a spiked coffee. Our server was great and attentive. I would definitely come back and try more of their cocktail menu.

Ordered the 3 combo app - Mozz sticks, wings, and pretzels. Decent pretzels, beware there's no salt on the pretzels and sode cheese was filled with crap- bacon and green onions. Moz sticks were cold, took 12 minutes for new fresh ones ( which did not have the parm cheese on them) wings were decent. Ordered the berry sangria- just don't do it. 12 minutes for a beer. I just don't suggest going here. Please note- it is a Tuesday at 730pm, so it is not busy at all at the restaurant.

I would like to start by saying that the service wasn't horribly awful, it just looked like the waitress didn't really care too much about the service, and the hamburgers are decent... But the reason I'm giving a 2 stars review is because of those salads... They were awful to say the least... Honestly how can you get a salad wrong when even Wendy's' taste better? First the chicken in the pecan chicken salad will haunt my dreams forever. It was one of the worst things I have EVER tasted, it had a horrible taste, like expired horrible... The crust had a foul smell like rancid oil, and it was almost raw... You can tell it was from a bag and they just heated it up for a few minutes... I don't understand how this is possible when the food took forever to arrive?! The chicken inside, if you can call that chicken... Was mushy and it just makes me sick thinking about it, I just pray to God that I'm soon able to forget about it.  I thought I would just ask for another chicken but my mom also asked for the same and her chicken was exactly like this as well, BAD! to the point where chicken nuggets are a gourmet delicacy compared to that... The lettuce was old with more black spots than a Dalmatian, and even though the waitress would asked us of the food was alright, she wouldn't even stick around long enough for us to tell her and didn't even get the hint even after we took all the breading off from the chicken and left it on the side of the plate. This was honestly a really unsatisfying and bad experience. I remember when a was a kid, they had to give me this orange flavored medicine and the flavor was so bad, I hated oranges until I was an adult. I just hope the same doesn't happen now with pecans because of this sad excuse of "pecan chicken" salad. And I humbly appeal to the hearts of these people to not feed this type of food to their customers anymore.

Tried to walk into a three-quarters full bar and was told by the man at the door that there was no seating available, despite the four or five clearly empty stools. When he put his hand out to block us we said "ok, how about one of those empty tables?" There were five at the front, I counted them to him. He still refused to let us in. Rude service like that? I certainly won't be returning.

I LOVE the happy hour every day special they have. We are here right before a movie that we had 30 min for and the food was ordered and brought out to us in a relatively quick manner. The food was delicious too but TGIF has always been on the pricier side for me so I wasn't particularly impressed with the food prices, however, the HAPPY HOUR is the way to go, although it's always happy hour there.

I was a regular customer for the past 3 years, but I think the service has gotten worse. The newer  wait staff needs more training. One waiter doesn't write our order down and gets everything wrong... TWICE. One waiter said we couldn't choose an alternate side for a dish that we always get and got mad when we asked for the manager. The manager is cool and tries to accommodate your needs. One of the hostesses doesn't smile... although I've seen her smile at a group of guys. This place feels like it's full of workers who don't want to work. Can't say anything about the bar because I usually sit at the tables with my family.

Came to this restaurant around 1230pm on a Tuesday for my brothers birthday. We decided to sit at the bar on an empty side with available sits. A couple came and sat on our side. When the bartender came back to the bar area he proceeds to take care of the couple first & walks pass us 3 times and never acknowledged us and made an effort to avoid eye contact with us. We got up and left!!! I would also like to mention that the bartender was Asian, the couple was White, and we are of course Black. I will never come back here! Totally unacceptable service or lack there of.

Just got done with HH at TGIF. Drinks were great however the food sucked. We ordered the flatbread the sliders, buffalo boneless chicken wings and mozzarella sticks. The flatbread was soggy and gross. Everything didn't seem fresh. It tasted as if it was all frozen and they just heated it in the microwave. Never eating here again.

If you like loud places Friday's is good for you. I ordered the All American stacked burger and it was a below average burger but the fries were good. The best thing was the service. The waiter was very friendly.

Ordered an app for the unlimited app thing and couldn't finish the last of my food and couldn't take it home. The manger said he'd rather throw it away than to give me a box. And tried to explain how a buffet works like I was stupid. Bar was so fast though. Sike no I lied that was super slow. Food was slow bar was slow, never taking my date there again. Thanks Friday's for wasting my money.

Always come here for the appetizers! My recent visit had the endless appetizers for $10(Unlimited appetizer of one choice) which was awesome. I hope they keep that coming.  Other than that, the only reason why I have that 4 star is because on my multiple visits, I would either get my main dish or appetizers warm, and not hot... I understand if it's busy, but at least don't let the dish get get cold. Otherwise a great location especially if you need to sober up at the movie theaters next door

Great place to go to at anytime actually, I've been there at noon for lunch and at midnight after a movie. Great location and great employees. From the hostess to the waiters they are highly active and kind. Food is always on point too!

The hostess is terrible here, the two Spanish girls need to be first. don't know their name but they weren't even doing their job. The place was not busy, those two just stood their did not even acknowledge me and my friend until i came up to them to ask for a table. Really bad service! That already killed the mood for the entire night. I wouldn't tell any of my friends to come back to this TGIF.  Our waitress was good though, did her job and was very friendly. Food was made properly but didn't have any taste on my shirlon steak that I had. I was recommended by a friend that TGIF has good steak but I tried it, did not taste anything good about it.

Can't comment on the food because I didn't stay. When I walked up to the restaurant, the music was so loud I almost walked away, but we decided to give it a shot. We asked for a quieter area.The hostess led us to a table and turned to say something to us, and we couldn't hear her. We decided it was best to leave.

I only write reviews if I feel like I have had an above or below average experience. This was not an above average experience. Came, sat at the bar and was served by a pleasant man. During my time, i struck up a friendly conversation with the guy next to me. Each time you order, the bartender gives you a receipt of what you received. I checked my tab before ordering another drink with a a blonde girl. When I finished I got my check. I guess this is where I was at fault? Since I had seen my check before and only ordered one more drink, I didn't feel the need to look at my receipt again. Unbeknownst to my knowledge someone at Friday's decided to combine my check with the guy next to me??? She came back saying she could only charge a certain amount on my card and I owed her 11.00. Confused, I asked why my tab was over 40.00 in the first place. After her mistake, she still felt the need to insist that the fault was mine asking for my check, though for some reason she had inferred I was paying for the man next to me. (I guess you can't have a friendly conversation with the man next you without someone inferring that one person is going to be paying for your meal.) my stay honestly left a sour taste in my mouth. Yes this is Friday's, I should not be expecting stellar service, but being that the girl was barely into her shift couldn't she tone down a bit with the attitude until later in the evening? Tried to try this place again one more time. I regret it. I now understand why the service is so poor here, the manager puts no effort in his work.

This review is for 'bar' only. I just want to say it was a great experience! I don't remember my bartender's name but she was very good at her job. Her service was good and her cocktails were on point. I went in on a Wednesday night so try week days. You won't be disappointed.

Went out to have a quick bite at TGIF in Tysons. My server, who didn't introduce herself so her name is unknown, came over and took our order. Did she tell me any specials (no), did she ask me is this my first time (no), she didn't even refill my drink after looking right at my empty cup. Did she stop and ask me how everything was? Hmmm guess the answer...NO. She didn't even ask me if I wanted dessert. She was horrible and I wish I knew her name just because she needs training on customer service. Short girl with long straight black hair. Horrible. Thumbs down.

Terrible service.  Our server was slow and rude. The wine was terrible and the liquor selection was lacking. The bartender tried to insist that Crown Royal was bourbon, which was very annoying. It took 30 minutes to get a refill of my drink and my check. The next time I have an hour to kill before a movie it won't be at this place.

Their cajun chicken pasta and fried green beans are amazing. They always get you extra sauce and cajun spice. The fried green beans are the best appetizers, hands down. However, its not all rainbows and unicorns. The service is a hit or miss, and frankly lately its more of a miss. The hostess gave the feeling that she's gonna strangle me to death. And it seems like she wants to hit someone, anyone...everyone. We wanted to sit outside. They said sure. The guy came and took us outside; why?- I foolishly asked- we don't have servers outside - he rudely responded- I didn't wanna argue since I was hungry and sat inside.  We ordered immediately. The fried green beans arrived. The main course is MIA after almost an hour and 15 mins.  Needless to say, I will only comeback here if I wanted to punish myself and talk to rude people who obviously hate their jobs.
I will give this 2stars. I was seated but had to go to restroom. When i came back my table had people sitting at it. I then was ushered another table and once i got my food my ribs were burnt. So sad

Met with some friends here last night. Food wasn't that good, but customer service was great. We were waited on by Anthony, young, nice and handsome gentleman. It was a busy night and he was very attentive and responsive to our needs. The manager on duty was visible and engaging. Very important in this line of business. I just want to say thank you for great customer service.  Gotta be better food second time around.

I've been here many times, and the food is, for the price, just OK.  I go there for the convenience of location when I'm in the mall. This past Sunday, the manager there looked genuinely surprised when we left because the Tyson's location wasn't carrying the NFL game we wanted to see. Seriously - when you overprice the food at a place like Tysons Corner, I find it hard to believe that Friday's can't fork over the cash for the Sunday ticket.  Especially when sports is supposedly a draw for you on Sundays.

While I do generally review positive places deserving of good press, this place deserves a ding for completely useless hostesses at the front.  Plus, the prior meal we had here was awful, so it's plenty deserved. Anyway. Short version:  The three(!) hostesses were collectively clueless. Memo:  don't speak to me like I'm stupid. Longer version, including a 1-Act Play:  "Never. Again. Here." Scene:   Showed up to Tyson's on a Sunday night, thought we'd get a quick bite/drink pre-movie.  There were plenty of open tables in the bar area, although the bar itself looked full. Me:  "Hi, 2 for the bar area?" Hostess #1  "The bar itself is self-seating, everything else you need to be seated for. But you can check the bar for a couple of seats first if you like." Me:  "Fine, we'll take a pass through then." (we walk in and look around; no seats available except singles; we are careful not to just grab one of many(!) open bar tables, and instead head back to hostess stand) Me:  (says NOTHING; I just got in line, and didn't even protest that some woman shoved her kid ahead of me so they could be attended to next) Hostess #1:  She looks up, sees me, and says, "See my hostess." (She then turns her back and starts talking to the woman) Me: "Um."  (Not even protesting, life is too short). Me:  (turns to hostess #2) "Hi, she told us to see you." Hostess #2:  "Hi, were your names called?" Me:  "What? No. We were just here, looked at the bar, and she (pointing to H1) told me to talk to you.  We were hoping to sit in the bar area." Hostess #3: (at a computer terminal) "Did you get a text?" Me:  "No. We were just here, tried to sit at the bar, and she (pointing to H1) to me to talk to her (pointing to H2)." My Brain:  "eject, this is a fucking clusterfuck already." H3:  "Oh, do you want to go look around the bar and see if you can get a stool there? All the other tables need to be seated." Me:  "We just did that." Brain:  "WHY THE HELL ARE WE STILL HERE?" H2:  "Did you get a text?" Me:  "We. Haven't. Put. Our. Names. In. Yet." H3:  "If you give me your name, I can put you on a list." Me, looking at all the open tables in the bar area:  "Don't bother." And, SCENE! Look, I get that Tyson's Corner has gone to hell, and that it's now a giant mass of humanity who wouldn't know an ounce of politeness if it were covered in gold chains and crushed velvet.  But the hostesses, ought to, you know, show some actual control, and be PROactive, not REactive to people walking up.  That's the advantage, presumably, of having 3 of them there. So, big ol' fail, and we just went to Five Guys, which had a better burger than this place could serve anyway. Edit:  I'm seeing a surprising number of reviews mentioning this place's various hostess fails, so maybe it was worth firing this review off after all.

This was the best experience I ever had at a Friday's restaurant. The waiter was super attentive. He would pop up somehow just when we needed a refill or something else. Every time he came to check on our table or refilled our drinks I made sure to thank him. The food was good. The waiter left a note on my receipt saying I was one of the nicest people he ever waited on.

We came here to watch the game as my husband's team, the Carolina Panthers, made it to the playoffs. We got seated in front of a bunch of tv's to choose from. Our waitress, Heidi, could see what team we were rooting to win thanks to my husband's jersey. She promptly said she was a Seahawks fan since that's her hometown team. I respect that, but still... we'll let the game decide. I don't know if it was due to the fact the Panthers were winning the game or not, but we got some pretty poor service the entire time. Our friends joined us a bit later and it just took a while to get their orders put in. It also took a while to get refills on my friend's soda throughout the entire game. We just felt that she didn't check up on us enough and we were there from kickoff until the end of the game. I think if she had, we probably would be more inclined to order more drinks and food than we did. Oh well, go panthers!

Food: Ordered salads and a burger and my son's favorite spinach dip.  Salads and burger wasn't bad.   Service: Not bad other than the actions that took place at the end.  Please read.... The reason I am writing this review is for you to be aware of an occurrence that took place with me on Saturday, January 30, 2015 in the evening.   My wife, son, and daughter went out to Tyson's to get a bite to eat ending up at Fridays.  Our WAITRESS (I forgot her name) took our order and served us...her service wasn't that bad.    After we finished, we grabbed the check and I provided her with my debit bank card with the visa logo.  She went to the back to charge the food and returned with the receipt.  As usual, I gave a 20% tip and went home.   On a normal Monday, I checked my financial accounts because that is what I always do.  This Monday was different; I had to find a total of $2,224 was spent at the local Best Buy and H.H. Greg.  This is very concerning because I only used my card at Fridays and at no other location that entire weekend!  Plus, I haven't been to Fairfax's Best Buy in years and never been to H.H. Greg. When working with the bank and the local authority, I looked at my Fridays receipt and noticed that the name of the waitress was not on it however a man's name (will not disclose to the public) handled the transaction in the back out of my sight.  Although the banks and police are handling the situation, I wanted you to be aware of this possibility.  I did speak with the manager at Fridays to make her aware of the possibility however there wasn't much concern from them. I am not saying that Fridays was the culprit but I do know that 1. The card was never used at any other location that weekend, 2. This was the only time I was in the Tyson's area that weekend, 3. I am not sure if it is standard practice however a female waitress served me and a male finalized my receipt, and 4. That was the only time the card was out of my possession. All that to say, use a Credit Card or Cash - not a bank card.  I will start using my credit cards instead of bank card for extra security.  FRIDAY'S HAS LOST MY TRUST IN DOING BUSINESS WITH THEM.

Great quick place to grab a bite before or after a movie! If possible, ask for Timmy Dang or Pablo Valencia. Both are great servers and are very attentive. Made my visit here every time very enjoyable.  I usually get the JD wings or the JD Burger with extra JD sauce!

It is to my shock as well that I am giving a mediocre at its absolute best chain restaurant 4 stars, however, I had quite a surprisingly pleasant experience here on a weekend evening. After trekking all the way out to Tysons for dinner and movie night, gift card in hand for a particular eatery only found at Tysons, we arrived sans reservations around 6:30 and were told they "were fully committed to reservations and could not accommodate walk in guests" that evening. The place was empty at this time but whatever. We called 3-4 other restaurants in the mall and were more or less told the same thing. I had not been to Fridays in at least 5 years , since it's always a rather painful experience with both food and service at any location, but they said it was only a 20 minute wait so here we found ourselves. First +1 was the actual wait was only 10 minutes. Second +1 was all day Saturday happy hour. Yes, you won't find anything beyond a mediocre beer on special but $4 for a Stella was fine by me especially after braving the absolutely ridiculous gobs of people who came from who knows where flooding the mall that day (but that's for another review...) I ordered the sizzling chicken and spinach (chicken on a bed of spinach with mushrooms, onions, and yellow squash) paired with a tomato and mozzarella salad. When the dish was brought out our server poured a miso glaze over the chicken for the "sizzling" effect. This dish was, and I'm still in shock myself, pretty tasty coming from a place more well known for its fried foods and wings. It was flavorful, due to the miso glaze, portion size was quite filling, and the tomato mozzarella salad was equal tomato to mozzarella ratio. My partner ordered a build your own burger with pepper jack, chipotle mayo, bacon, and fries. He was a happy camper. The real star of this experience, and why I'm awarding the extra star to what would have been a 3 star review, was our server, Ebenezer. I can truly say he provided one of the best service experiences I have had in quite some time. He was on top of everything, whether it was another drink or getting us condiments and extra napkins without even asking. He checked on us regularly and got us checked out quickly when we were cutting it close to our movie time. Kudos to him for really making our time at Fridays more than palatable!

I've come here before, often more packed than tonight..  but seemingly they dropped the ball. I remember when T.G.I.F.'s were a weekly event for my group of friends.. so tonight we hit the town with nostalgia and ended up with stomachs half empty/half regretful.   Our waiter started off nice.. but slowly we started to realize something was amiss...  Start:  -he didn't place a partial order of ours, eventually placing our whole order..  -disappearing.. -appetizer arrived before our drinks  - utensils arrived after asking for them... upon getting drinks after appetizers  -waiter didn't take away the menus after we ordered  -plates and menus remained on table and after asking for removal.. only the menu's were removed.. -plates were removed upon arrival of main course. Food: -Spinach dip = very good -peach sangria = strong, but delicious..  way too much ice. 4-5 large sips and no more drink.. -had to ask for water during main course..  waiter never brought any over nor offered upon seeing empty glasses for 20min.. -Jack Daniel's ribeye - medium rare = cooked properly in color.. horrible cut of steak. Extremely tough,  way too salty.  Seasoned fries were the best part of the meal.. mozzarella and tomatoes side.. contained about 4-5 small pieces of mozzarella, more tomatoes and lots of onions.. not a good side Maybe I've just been spoiled with having higher quality steaks lately.. but for a $20 steak.. I was disheartened to spit out about 3 pieces then stop half way.. realizing it wasn't edible for me..  Ah, and call me old fashioned..  but I didn't really appreciate the lack of a paper check.. our waiter was using a tablet.. but after asking for the check.. he just announced the price to the two of us.. and stood there awkwardly asking for payment. I get the convince factor.. but if I bring someone out on a date (thankfully this wasn't one) I'm surely going to stay far away from the new T.G.I.F..  Kicker - a table of teen girls next to us were sitting alone and a table of two lonely guys in their twenties were at the table next to them.. we got the pleasure of watching him fail miserably with a series of pickup lines.. then regress after learning they were underaged.. talk about an awkward moment.. then having to sit back down... adjacent to them..

Came here for drinks on a Sunday afternoon. Luckily they have $5 mimosas and bloody mary's. My friend and I ordered a few rounds of drinks and split a sub-par French dip sandwich. The bread was crusty but could've been fresher and stuffed with more filling. We ordered fries as our side and they were seasoned well, no other major compliments for this place.  This place is a staple for drinks anytime I'm in Tysons and when GB or Seasons are too busy. Drinks could be a bit stiffer and the bartenders could be a bit kinder but I understand that the bar fills up quickly.

Decent food but the service is very hit or miss. Let me just tackle both of these items separately: Food is decent, some of it is pretty solid 4 star quality but other choices are pretty meh. For example their key West shrimp and Jack Daniels burger are pretty top notch and flavorful, but their mozzarella sticks can be a little bland sometimes and the fried green beans can taste a little odd (like a watery, greasy green bean flavor, bleh...). Most of the food is still pretty good and if you come here during endless apps with friends its easy to get a cheap meal of 12 bucks a person for all the pit stickers and boneless BBQ wings you can eat! (Or just do the 10 dollars for an endless ap, its very easy to save money during endless aps if you calculate your math right!) The service is...honestly I've had more bad experiences than good. I've gone to the front to be brought to a table and the lady was texting in her phone for 5 minutes until I cleared my throat and she finally realized my party was right in front of her. I've had servers disappear on me to the point where I had to literally get up and look for them. I've had a waitress bring me the wrong check TWICE and even then wrongfully charge me for things I didn't order. I've had a virgin strawberry daiquiri brought to me and it was mixed in the strangest way (the daiquiri mix was on the bottom half of the drink and the ice was in the top half, how do you even do that...?)! Whether the place is busy or packed, there's only about a 1/3 to 50/50 chance your service won't have some form of trouble or another. Every time I have been there I noticed that the staff tend to flock where the food is served, and when I sat right next to that area I discovered that all they really do is gossip around random stuff. Just my two cents, but if you can sit at the bar or get a good server, the food is worth a try.

The one thing I love about TGI Fridays are their APPETIZERS! Every time I come here I end up just ordering appetizers as my meal  their spinach dip and mozzarella sticks are some of my go-tos  The service here is not bad for how busy they get. And they pretty much just leave you to hang around if that's what you want (:

..made mistakes on my Mothers' orders, didn't introduce themselves as servers, and my jack Daniel flat iron steak was cooked improperly and burger was too "greasy".  I didn't take any culinary courses, but I am quite sure I will never recommend my family and friends to go to this TGIF franchise establishment.  And it's Easter Sunday...
Want here with my friend and it was awesome just had the bottomless apps and red bull and got full off that. our waitress was awesome too will come back!

Endless appetizers are a scam more or less. They take so long to come out that it's impossible to take advantage of it. The food tastes good but it shouldn't take 15 minutes for each appetizer to come out. By the way, it's not busy at all. We're like one of five tables in the restaurant. So if you're coming here for the endless appetizers then don't bother. But, if your just drinking or trying to watch a game... I guess it's okay. How many more words do I need until I get out of the average length review. Do people actually have this much to say about eating at restaurants. I just want to get a higher yelp ranking. Omg it's still at average length. What more can I write? Okay well I also had the mahi mahi which wasn't bad but it was really flavorless, though I usually prefer my foods to be toned down in the flavor department. Especially when it comes to sugar. I can't stand super sweet things unless it's chocolate. Wtf I'm still at average length. I've already written a fucke now book at this point. Okay finally. K bye.

The manager himself refused to serve me alcohol because the word "VOID" was punched into an unexpired driver's license. I had to take a few minutes to explain to this man the law and he still refused because it went against TGI Friday's policy. If you're going to operate any business, you need to be fully aware of the law and anyone would agree that the law triumphs private policies in any case.  I would suggest yelpers in Tysons to check out other similar restaurants in the mall like Earl's, Brio or Gordon Biersch. Their management and service are significantly better! Plus, when you order a drink, even on the rocks, it won't be watered down.

Food was amazing! Everything was cooked to perfection and quite better than any other area location. Staff is great, managers walking around making sure everything is okay. I went around 6:30pm, no wait and a decent crowd but nothing overwhelming. Food also arrived quickly. Got a chance to try the new garlic boneless wings and they are amazing! I will definitely be back!  Keep up the good work! The managers Angie and Janelle were sooooo nice. Go here, you will not be disappointed.

Definitely was seated at the table for 15 mins without being check on by anyone before leaving. You know a place doesn't train their people well, if at all when employees continue to walk past you without saying a word.  This is the second time this has happened at this location. There won't be a third. Very disappointed, if I could give zero stars I would.

Wait time was not look at all but the staff was horrible. I come too the door where I'm suppose to be greeted and seated, and not one staff member acknowledge me until I said hello. Once assisted by a staff member they assumed it was just my son and I. Politely I tell her it's 3 adults 2 kids but one child will be needing a high chair and the other a sling because I had he car seat. Any body would thought ok, they have kids let's make room and get them a nice table. The host took me too a round booth and I simply asked would we fit in there he realized I had a car seat and it wouldn't.  so they gave us two tables and made space. Good came out on time, but the service killed me. I'll still too my tgi Friday in silver spring. I love the people there

Checked in last night but just got around to putting up photos and my review.  It started off poorly when I got to TGI Fridays. I walked up to the hostess table and I know she saw me but she blatantly ignored me for a couple minutes until I first spoke up and asked "excuse me can I get a table?"  If this didn't already put us in an annoyed mood, it was our waitress who made our experience even worse. She was in her early 20s and since we were the same age group as her, I guess she thought she could treat us as if we're close friends. One of the friends I've ate with is an experienced server and we couldn't help but notice her every mistake. When taking our orders she leaned on our table with her elbows and hands touching our table with her butt sticking out. ??? We aren't your friends visiting you while you're working so please don't do that it's just so unprofessional and comes off as being rude. Also we were getting the 12$ deal (main entree and cocktail) and when we were showing her our ID, one of us had a NY license (the bendable kind) and she goes on to say rude things like 'oh is this even real? I mean I don't really care if it's fake or real I just check it because I have to' okay first of all, it's real and it's real rude to be saying those things to your customer. If you suspect that it's fake, ask for another ID or just go and scan it. After all that, I had to keep asking her if she got the right order because at this point I wouldn't be surprised if she messed something up. And after our entrees came out, she only came by once.. Honestly for such a big chain like TGI Fridays we shouldn't be in that situation with an inexperienced, unprofessional waitress. Our food was mediocre like my truffle burger was way too salty. For the price i paid yesterday I might give it another try... but honestly the service has got to change. Especially for such a prime spot (located inside Tysons Corner Mall), more is expected.

So, I was there last Friday and totally enjoyed the loud music and my alcoholic drinks! Now, I've been going to TGIFridays for years and this is my second time at this location and I was still not pleased with their "Jack Daniel Strips", they tasted just like the ones you get out of the frozen food aisle in your favorite supermarket.

Worst TGIF I have been too. WORST EVER SERVICE! This happened to me four times.  The servers didn't care to ask if the food's good and didn't refill my glass of water as well! I know it can get crowded given the fact that it's inside a mall but the servers kept asking around and passed by our table many times but never looked as I was helplessly trying to ask for something. Sad but I won't be going again!

Very loud, given that there's the food court just across the way and the kiddie train driving around constantly. Staff was attentive at times and slow at others. The first beer glass that arrived had a lipstick mark on it, so I question the system of cleaning their glasses/dishes. Food was good. They've stepped their game up.

Went for the advertised "Endless Apps" for $10.  Service wasn't bad, but the food was awful.  "Boneless wings" were just tiny pieces of chicken with very heavy breading - Chicken McNuggets are far better.  "Loaded Potato Skins" had no visual appear, nor any taste at all - probably came frozen from a factory.  "Pot Stickers" were tough and had little filling - another frozen, cheap factory product?  A waste of time and calories. Cleanliness of the restaurant leaves a lot to be desired.  Seats in our booth were dirty.  The floor of the restaurant was littered with straw wrappers and paper napkins - but the staff never seems to stop and pick up trash.  This was a busy late Saturday afternoon, but managers were obviously not keeping an eye on things.

It was such a bad service, how can it take 10 mins just for cold ice water!!! and 40 MINS FOR ENTREE!! It was a sunday but they were not busy, and this is not the first time I been to them. The waitress barely refill our drink and of course she rather talking than working, and all employee were just standing infront the door way just to chit chat, no check up on their customer HORRIBLE!! Don't go there with kids!

Worst Friday's ever! The waitress assumed that my African American friend would not give her a tip, so she didn't bother to return my friend's change to her. When my friend tried to explain how insulting and biased that was of the waitress to treat her like that, the waitress acted like it was no big deal! Then, the waitress charged my card for both of our meals! When I spoke to the manager for a refund, he tried to deny that I was overcharged and that I must have bought all that food. When he refused to give me a refund, luckily my bank cancelled the transaction. NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN!

Had a terrible experience tonight.   My wife's order was late to the table and when it came it was wrong (manager agreed it was wrong)  and had to be remade.   Worst part is when I asked for a discount, the manger complained that he served us many times before and  that we always had a problem and asked for free food.  I shouldn't have to pay for a meal if it comes out 30-40 minutes after the rest of the food came out.    Isn't fun for my wife to watch everyone eat (and finish eating) before she gets her first bite.     I never met this guy before and first time I asked for anything free (at any restaurant).    I can't even remember a time we have ever complained at a Friday's and I considered this location the best one.    This manager was very disrespectful and embarrassed me and my family, and we were celebrating my wife's birthday to boot.   He ultimately comped my wife's entree, but this made me never want to eat at this location ever again.    I don't know the managers name but we (or really just my wife) finished our food at 10:45pm 8-26-2016.     I hope someone from management sees this comment and fix this issue.   No manager should ever speak to a customer in this way and in all my years I've never been spoken to that way at a restaurant by a manager.   Also to be clear, my family and I were very respectful and easy to talk to, don't know why it came to this.

I really can't stand the incompetence of the servers and waiters/waitresses here.  My bf and I often come for the endless appetizers but a server who was clueless of the matter told us they didn't have it anymore. We were distraught to hear by our fellow friends that they had come later that night to have ordered what we thought was off the menu. I wish the employees here would have basic knowledge of their restaurant as well as have better service without the long waits  for seating and so on. The  poor manners/attitudes by the servers here are beyond belief.  But what's worse is after all that wait and attitude, you get lousy food and pay large sums of tips for people who don't deserve it.  I recommend other restaurants for great quality food and service.
Endless appetizers came nearly 10-15mins apart. Worst service ever. Very incompetent, unfriendly staff.

Delicious food as always.  Waitering service was very disappointing . My waiter, Tony, ignored me the entire time. He didn't check on my food, I called after him once and I know he heard me because he looked over when he thought I turned away. When the check is ready , he  just left it at the table without saying anything . I am not use to this kind of service and I love to give me waiters 20% because I was a waitress and I know how it goes.  I left Tony a $0.00 for tip and left him " poor waitering service" on the paper.  I would go back but I don't want him to serve me.

I love the food here as I always get the same thing. It just sucks giving one star because the service is hit or miss. Out of all the times I've been here, I've only had one good server and that was during the lunch hour. Every time I come in the evening, the hosts ignore me and half the time I need to ask to be seated. The servers are nice but not very attentive. Drinks never get refilled and always come AFTER the appetizers. If it weren't for being in the mall, I wouldn't come back.

Although I have dined at TGI Friday's many times, this review is more on the person working the door at TGI Friday's. I had my infant daughter with me and I was looking for some hot water to heat up her formula.  I walked around the food court asking about six different restaurants for hot water to heat up the formula; they all said they had none.  As it was on the other side of the food court I got to TGI Friday's last.  I asked the lady working the door, Jessica, how much it would be to buy a cup of hot water so that I could heat up a bottle of formula. She said that I could have it for free, that she would get it for me.  Just when I was starting to lose faith in my fellow man, she redeemed it. Friday's has an excellent staff; keep up the good work.

I haven't been to any FRIDAYS for almost a year - the last time I was at a TGI Fridays, I was upset with almost everything we ordered. The buffalo boneless chicken wings were cold, the burger buns were cold, the beers (and literally everything) came too slow. Today the history repeats. I know it is childish to say never, but "But we are never ever ever ever getting back together. Like, ever...!!!"

I am highly upset at the lazy service. I watched servers stand and hang out at the expo area while my burger hung out on the window!!! I had to inform someone to get my burger and even she just dropped the plates in front of us and walked off!!! My dark haired bartender tried her best to make things better but I asked for a Sprite and ended up drinking soda water. Was it that busy that nobody could change the syrup? Where is the hospitality? Because no manager was found or seen prospecting tables!! The manager here is slacking!!!   No hospitality at all!!! Thanks for the cold ass burger and lazy service. I wanted to just run back there and just run the food myself!!! If your staff is that lazy then u guys need to staff up!!! It wasn't even busy. I feel sorry for this place!!!!! A manager better contact me asap!!! I'll take further action if need be. I asked for a to go box and they gave me a small ass container I smushed my food into it furiously and just left!!!
Busy and crowded. Staff was clearly working hard but there was just a ton of people to keep up with. Not the best service, and some of the food was a little cold, but overall good experience.
